Subject: Console use detrimental?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=27855065
X-Yahoo-Profile: bergmark_d


I just wrote my first pluggable module and did a two-minute crawl with
it, running the crawl from the console.  I was very surprised to see
that my module's constructor was called twice!  (This was seen via
debugging prints to heritrix_out.log.)  Suspicious, I then reran the
order file with the -n switch on heritrix.  Without the console, the
constructor was called only once, as expected.

Without looking at the .jsp's in any detail, it appears that each
invocation of my module comes after a slightly different series of
webapp events.  In Java-land, both invocations started from
ThreadPool.java line 511 (in PoolThread.run).  The non-console run
starts with Heritrix.main which calls doStart which calls
doOneCrawl and is then off and running.

Has anyone else observed this problem with the console?  Was it just
operator error on my part?  

It can be dangerous to have your constructor called twice, since you
might want to do some one-time I/O, for example.  Since the problem
can be worked around, it is not too serious, but I was curious.

Regards, D.
